data.name: BESPOKE_SERVICE_CONTENT
data.value:
Every refrigeration or air-conditioning system is different. Here at ECAC we understand that an off the shelf course will not suit everybody’s requirements and therefore we will design and deliver training to suit your unique requirements.


We will visit your site, discuss your requirements and examine your refrigeration or Air-conditioning equipment. We will then produce a first draft training outline which will be issued to you for approval. When the content has been agreed we will produce all the course materials specifically designed to suit your requirements.


We are also aware that it is sometimes difficult to arrange training due to shift patterns. We at ECAC will work around your staff availability, be that during the day, in the evening or at weekends

data.name: EMPLOYABILITY_SERVICES_CONTENT
data.value:
ECAC has a reputation for innovation and responsiveness to the requirements of Industry and the employees of Industry. We are aware that the days of a ‘job for life’ are a thing of the past and whether it be through choice or circumstances many people will change their job or employer many times over their lifetime.

We have developed a range of services designed to meet the requirements of our clients who are dealing with a career change or are in the process of helping their employees to prepare for redundancy or a change of employer.

Career Guidance

Our Career Guidance expert, Dr. Brian Staines, has over 30 years’ experience in Career guidance and employability. Brian works with both groups and individuals in order to identify future career opportunities and options based on both the individuals past experience and qualifications and their ambitions for the future.

Typically Brian works with groups from companies currently dealing with redundancies to help their employees identify and prepare for opportunities in the future. The typical career guidance seminar will commence with a group session where the relevant staff members will participate in an employability workshop both to identify current skills and future ones that they would wish to develop. On completion of this Brian will work with individuals discussing and advising on the specifics of their situation and drawing up an action plan for future activities.

Career Guidance

In conjunction with our Language and Communication specialist, Mr Robert Howe MA, and Dr Staines, each participant will be given the opportunity to develop a Curriculum Vitae to current international standards. The clients will be helped to develop a C.V. which emphasises their skills and experience as well as their employability. Rob will concentrate on the use of language and syntax While Brian will concentrate on developing the specific information to be used in the C.V.

C.V. (German)

As part of our translation services we can also provide you with a C.V. in German, however, unlike a direct translation service we will develop your C.V. specifically for the German jobs market.

data.name: FGAS_OVERVIEW_CONTENT
data.value:
ECAC offers the full range of City & Guilds 2079 Fgas training and certification. We are the main provider of these qualifications in the Irish market and have been offering City & Guilds qualifications for over 10 years.

There are four levels in the qualification:

2079 100 (Cat 1)

Successful candidates will be qualified to undertake leak checking, recovery, installation, service and maintenance of equipment.

2079 200 (Cat 2)

Successful candidates will be qualified to undertake installation, service and maintenance of equipment with a charge of less than 5 Tons equivalent CO2 and leakage checking.

2079 300 (Cat 3)

Successful candidates will be qualified to undertake the recovery of refrigerants on small systems.

2079 400 (Cat 4)

Successful candidates will be qualified to undertake leakage checking.

For each qualification, candidates will be required to successfully complete both of the following assessments:

  • One Practical Assessment
  • One Theoretical Assessment

Grading and Marking

Grading of assessments for these units and qualifications is pass or fail. The theoretical, multiple choice assessment is externally marked by EVOLVE. The practical assessment is internally marked and externally verified.

Training

Training days will cover all aspects of the F gas assessment with a strong emphasis on the requirements of the EVOLVE online theory assessment.

All Candidates are required to bring the following Items for the Assessment

  • Copy of photo I.D. (passport, license etc.)
  • Full P.P.E. (Including steel capped boots, fire retardant overalls etc.)
  • Candidates may use their own equipment and tools for the assessment subject to safety requirements, alternately, equipment will be provided.
